Hi,

    Some months have been since my last mail, I have been researching=

two stuffs:

1)  Use of Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) with NEAT  (see
http=
://www.idsia.ch/~juergen/lstm/ to know more about LSTM).
2)  Development of=
 Work methods to use NEAT-LSTM and some classifiers
like Cascade-Adaboost t=
o solve real Automation Industry problems in a
feasible way.


1) NEAT-LSTM=
:
Abstract:
       The LSTM are a cell of neurons that are able to store a =
value
during long periods. That is a problem in all Recurrent Networks,
val=
ues are difficult to store more than 10-50 iterations in the
network (see L=
STM Link for references). 

	I put LSTM inside a NEAT. The evolution make N=
EAT to use LSTM cells
in a productive way storing key values, recovering th=
at values when
they are useful a forgetting them  if it is useful (The 3 LS=
TM cell
functions).

	My analysis of some of the solve problems suggest tha=
t LSTM helps to
NEAT in some problems to reduce greatly the searching space=
 helping to
memorize (some times to accumulate) some important key events t=
hat are
used after to get out the right outputs.

	An intuitional example a=
bout reduction of searching space is serial
XOR, if you solve serial XOR wi=
th NEAT you can see that the solution
net use recurrent connection to store=
 the first value and later it
compares with second value in the serial sequ=
ence. In my computer (P4
2,4Ghz) it last around  2 minutes to find a soluti=
on with NEAT alone.
However, when I use one LSTM cell in the NEAT-LSTM it l=
ast ONLY 5
SECONDS!!!!!.

2)  Improving Work Methods in Real Automation Pro=
blems:

      Motivation: Evolution systems have been achieving great resul=
ts
in last years. In my daily work in automation projects business, I
have =
to face another problem: cost. That is the reason that most of
the times th=
e industry try to avoid complex systems. Complex systems
are difficult to d=
evelop, difficult to modify and difficult to
maintenance. Most of the times=
, it is the last choosen resource. 

	Other problems to use evolution syste=
ms are the uncertainty.  Always,
there is some likelihood that a problem wi=
ll converge to a solution in
a reasonable time. Some time we can evaluate i=
t, sizing the searching
space. Other times it very difficult to size such s=
pace. Uncertainty
is a variable related to, what is known in business as, r=
isk. 

	Some recent experiment as in 
http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/downloads/pap=
ers/whiteson.gecco03.pdf suggest
that a way to reduce searching space is to=
 "draw" the guide
where the
solution will be searched. Some of my research =
has gone in that
direction. In most of the systems we have deal with, we ha=
ve some
previous knowledge about them. My work is focusing in how organize
=
such previous knowledge in: decision trees, tasks, abstraction levels
and i=
nterdependences among them to reduce as much as possible the
searching spac=
e. So the final goal is to find feasibility work methods
and tools to use e=
volution systems in real automation Industry
problems.

Regards.

Germ=E1n.=
